summary: This document is a credit card application approval record from Navy Federal Credit Union, dated September 27, 2008. It shows an application for a rewards Visa card with a $2,500 limit was approved for an applicant who listed their employer as the 'DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE' with an annual salary of $57,000. The document is significant as it appears to be a financial record of a Department of Justice employee during the period of the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Applicant
persons.context: Individual who applied for and was approved for a Navy Federal Credit Union nRewards Visa card, listing the Department of Justice as their employer.

events.title: Credit Card Application Submitted and Approved
events.description: A credit card application was submitted to Navy Federal Credit Union and approved for a $2,500 limit nRewards Visa card.

keyFacts: A credit card application was approved on September 27, 2008, for an applicant who listed the 'DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE' as their employer.
The applicant reported an annual salary of $57,000 and had been at their job for 8 years and 9 months.
The approved credit card was a Navy Federal Credit Union nRewards Visa with a credit limit of $2,500 and a 17.9% APR.
